The Best Kitchen Products to Buy at Anthropologie's Spring Sale | Bon Appétit

Yeah, probably.By Zoë SessumsApril 6, 2018FacebookTwitterEmailAnthropologieFacebookTwitterEmailNot to enable you...but Anthropologie is having a huge home sale to kick off spring until April 8. Specifically, that means 20 percent off full-price kitchen products including plates, mugs, and cheese boards. We culled through the patterns and florals to bring you our favorite things to buy this weekend—all under $100.Anthropologie
Hand Painted MugsAvailable in peach, mint, and white, these mugs by Canadian artist Cathy Terepocki are meant to be paired with your go-to warm beverage.Buy It: Cathy Terepocki Ontario Mug, $12 (originally $14)Anthropologie
Patterned BowlsThese vibrant stoneware bowls are part of an exclusive collection by London-based artist Anna Beam. Their bright and poppy designs will add more excitement to your desk lunch grain bowls.Buy It: Freeform Bowl, $12 (originally $14)Anthropologie
Pie DishIf this buttery apple cake also got you thinking about pie, you’ll need a handcrafted dish that’ll look good when the slices begin to disappear.Buy It: Glenna Pie Dish, $34 (originally $42)Anthropologie
Brass FlatwareThis five-piece stainless steel, brass, and aluminum set has a nice rose gold sheen. An excellent accompaniment to date night dinners.Buy It: Hettie Flatware, $47 (originally $58)Anthropologie
Cheese BoardChoose your own cheese adventure and invest in your cheese-loving self with this fanciful new board.Buy It: Gemfield Cheese Board, $55-$79 (originally $68-$98)Anthropologie
Flatware SetWhen you want to throw a dinner party and have all your utensils match, this stainless steel set is one to show off.Buy It: Parkway 20-Piece Flatware Set, $80 (originally $100)Anthropologie
Dinner PlatesFor those of us who seek out beautiful plates to present (and Instagram) our food on, these pastel-colored ones make a nice statement and don’t need to be hand-washed.Buy It: Zephyr Dinner Plate, $15 (originally $18)Anthropologie
Tiered Storage BowlsFor picnics and road trips, these stackable enameled stainless steel bowls are portability at its chicest.Buy It: Tiffin Tiered Storage Bowl Set, $55 (originally $68)Anthropologie
Mini Bowl SetNo matter if you lean toward salty, cheesy, or sweet, display your snacks in these mini teak bowls. They’re light, simple, and encourage easy entertaining.Buy It: Teak Mini Square Bowl Set, $20 (originally $24)Anthropologie
Knife RackIf you’ve amassed a knife collection to display with pride, here’s a visually appealing option that strays from the typical utilitarian magnet look.Buy It: Mounted Knife Rack, $28 (originally $34)Your cheese board could use these crackers:Explore Bon AppétitShoppingRead MorerestaurantsWe Go to This Restaurant Just to Stare at the CeramicsBy Zan RomanoffshoppingThe Best Dutch Ovens at Every Price Point According to Bon Appétit EditorsBy Alex BeggsRecipes you want to make.
